By Swastika Mukhopadhyay
NewsRise
KOLKATA (Jan 27) -- India's Bharti Airtel said its Airtel Africa unit will be included in Britain’s leading share index FTSE 100 from Jan. 31.

This “underscores the growing investor confidence in the business,” the company said in a filing to the stock exchanges today. Airtel Africa, which had a market capitalization of $7.5 billion as of Jan. 26, was listed on the London Stock Exchange in 2019, it said.

Bharti had, in 2010, entered Africa through the acquisition of mobile operations of Kuwait’s Zain across 15 countries in the region. Today, the company is present across 14 African countries.

The latest announcement comes a day before Bharti’s board is set to meet to consider raising capital through a preferential issue of shares.

Shares of Bharti Airtel fell 0.7% to 707 rupees in Mumbai trading. The benchmark S&P BSE Sensex lost 1.4%.
